refnamediv.refpurpose: Functions to copy new files to the iPod

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: itdb_cp_track_to_ipod ()
refsect2.para: Copy one track to the iPod. The PC filename is filename and is taken literally.
The mountpoint of the iPod (in local encoding) is expected in track->itdb->mountpoint.
If track->transferred is set to TRUE, nothing is done. Upon successful transfer track->transferred is set to TRUE.
For storage, the directories "f00 ... fnn" will be cycled through.
The filename is constructed as "gtkpod"<random number> and copied to track->ipod_path. If this file already exists, <random number> is adjusted until an unused filename is found.
If track->ipod_path is already set, this one will be used instead. If a file with this name already exists, it will be overwritten.
track->filetype_marker is set according to the filename extension

listitem.simpara: the Itdb_Track to copy (containing filename metadata)
return location for a GError or NULL
TRUE on success, FALSE on error, in which case error is set accordingly.

refsect2.title: itdb_filename_fs2ipod ()
refsect2.para: Convert string from casual PC file name to iPod iTunesDB format using ':' instead of G_DIR_SEPARATOR_S (ie slashes on Unix-like systems). ipod_file is modified in place.

refsect2.title: itdb_filename_ipod2fs ()
refsect2.para: Convert string from from iPod iTunesDB format to casual PC file name using G_DIR_SEPARATOR (ie slashes on Unix-like systems) instead of ':'. ipod_file is modified in place.

refsect2.title: itdb_filename_on_ipod ()
refsect2.para: Return the full iPod filename as stored in track.
NOTE: NULL is returned when the file does not exist.

NOTE: this code works around a problem on some systems (see itdb_resolve_path() ) and might return a filename with different case than the original filename. Don't copy it back to track unless you must

listitem.simpara: full filename to track on the iPod or NULL if no filename is set in track. Must be freed with g_free() after use.

refsect2.title: itdb_musicdirs_number ()
refsect2.para: Determine the number of F.. directories in iPod_Control/Music.
If itdb->musicdirs is already set, simply return the previously determined number. Otherwise count the directories first and set itdb->musicdirs.

listitem.simpara: max number of directories in iPod_Control/Music

refsect2.title: itdb_rename_files ()
refsect2.para: Renames/removes some files on the iPod (Playcounts, OTG semaphore). May have to be called if you write the iTunesDB not directly to the iPod but to some other location and then manually copy the file from there to the iPod.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError or NULL
FALSE on error and sets error accordingly
